title: The Gauntlet

properties.name: description
properties.value: The Gauntlet is a solo minigame in Prifddinas in which the player is given a limited amount of time to explore a randomly generated dungeon layout, gather various resources and supplies by skilling and defeating crystalline monsters, all in preparation to defeat the Crystalline Hunllef, which is based upon a deadly wolf-like predator from the elven homeworld of Tarddiad. The Gauntlet was created as a training ground by the Amlodd Clan to ensure their warriors were capable of defending Prifddinas during the God Wars.

content:
This article has a strategy guide here.
All information on mechanics and strategy will be on this page.
This article has money making guides: Completing The Gauntlet, Completing The Corrupted Gauntlet.
Please add tips to the subpages, rather than the article below.
This is a dangerous activity.
You cannot bring any items into or out of this activity. On death, Hardcore Ironmen will lose their status, and any items stored in any Item Retrieval Service will be deleted.
The Gauntlet
Released 25 July 2019 (Update)
Type Minigame
Members Yes
Location Prifddinas
Participants 1
Skills Combat, skilling
Reward currency No
Tutorial No
Music The Gauntlet
Location
This article is about The Gauntlet. For the gloves, see gauntlets.

The Gauntlet is a solo minigame in Prifddinas in which the player is given a limited amount of time to explore a randomly generated dungeon layout, gather various resources and supplies by skilling and defeating crystalline monsters, all in preparation to defeat the Crystalline Hunllef, which is based upon a deadly wolf-like predator from the elven homeworld of Tarddiad. The Gauntlet was created as a training ground by the Amlodd Clan to ensure their warriors were capable of defending Prifddinas during the God Wars.

The Gauntlet can be found by entering the Gauntlet Portal, found in the north-western part of Prifddinas.

Players cannot bring any items into The Gauntlet; when entering the minigame, all items currently on the player will be automatically stored for its duration. It is a dangerous minigame, so hardcore ironmen will lose their hardcore status, and ultimate ironmen will lose items in instanced banks should they die in The Gauntlet.

The area contains resource nodes, herbs and fish obtainable through Mining, Woodcutting, Fishing and other gathering methods, in order to make weapons, armour, potions and food. These various resources do not require a specific skill level to gather. The dungeon will also contain various crystalline monsters, such as bats, unicorns and dark beasts, which can be killed for further supplies. Higher level monsters will offer better drops at the cost of taking more time to defeat.

Completion of The Gauntlet will reward players with various loot, including crystal armour seeds for crystal armour, as well as Enhanced crystal weapon seeds for the Blade of Saeldor or the Bow of Faerdhinen and the crystal shards required to charge the items. Failing to finish, either by death or leaving early, will give a small token reward based upon how well the player performed, but won't grant any chance of unique items.

Contents

  • 1 Basic overview
    • 1.1 Starting items
    • 1.2 Starting room
    • 1.3 Resource rooms
      • 1.3.1 Resource nodes

      • 1.4.2 Armour
    • 1.5 Boss room
  • 2 Corrupted Gauntlet
    • 2.1 Boss Room
    • 2.2 Rewards

    • 3.1 Unique Rewards (Normal Mode)
    • 3.2 Unique Rewards (Corrupted Mode)
  • 4 Combat Achievements
    • 4.1 Normal Gauntlet
    • 4.2 Corrupted Gauntlet
  • 5 Changes
  • 6 Trivia
  • 7 References

Basic overview[edit | edit source]

The player will spawn in the starting room of a 7x7 grid of rooms adjacent to the centre room that contains The Gauntlet's boss: the Crystalline Hunllef. The player has 10 minutes to prepare to fight this boss, which is indicated by a timer. If the timer runs out, the player will automatically get teleported into the boss room. The player can also choose to manually enter the boss room before the counter ends.

During this 10 minute preparation time, the player may use the resources of The Gauntlet's environment to create a set up to challenge the Crystalline Hunllef. This set up may consist of three tiers of halberds, staves, bows, helmets, body armours and leg armours, as well as food and a potion that restores run energy and prayer points.

Starting items[edit | edit source]

The player starts with a few items in their inventory and they will be wielding a crystal sceptre. These items will be needed for exploring the rooms and collecting resources.

Item Effect
Crystal sceptre This item is required to light nodes (i.e. to visit new rooms). It can also be used as a weak melee weapon.
Crystal axe Used to chop Phren bark
Crystal pickaxe Used to mine Crystal ore
Crystal harpoon Used to fish Raw paddlefish
Pestle and mortar Used to grind Crystal shardsx10 into Crystal dustx10 and to grind each Crystal spike, Crystal orb, Crystalline bowstring into Crystal shardsx80
Teleport crystal Single-use item for teleporting the player back to the starting room.

Starting room[edit | edit source]

Features of the starting room

The player will start adjacent to the central room. This room contains a few features that are used for processing the collected resources.

  • Crystal Singing Recipes: A bookstand players can click to get an overview of all recipes for armour and weaponry found within The Gauntlet.
  • Egniol Potions: A bookstand players can click to read a text describing the use and recipe of egniol potions.
  • Range: Used to cook Raw paddlefish into Paddlefish.
  • Singing Bowl: Used to craft vials, teleport crystals, armour and weapons.
  • Teleport Platform: Used to abandon the current challenge.
  • Tool Storage: Used to re-obtain crystal sceptre, crystal axe, crystal pickaxe, crystal harpoon and pestle and mortar
  • Water Pump: Used to turn vials into water-filled vials, which are needed to make Egniol potions.

Resource rooms[edit | edit source]

Each room in The Gauntlet, except for the starting room and the boss room, contains resource nodes and/or monsters. These resource nodes and monsters are farmed to collect resources that can be processed at the Singing Bowl in the starting room.

Resource nodes[edit | edit source]

There are five types of resource nodes. Each resource room will contain zero to five resource nodes. A resource room may contain a combination of different resource nodes.

  • Crystal Deposit: Used to mine crystal ore from. Three crystal ores can be collected from each Crystal Deposit. Used for creating armour within The Gauntlet.
  • Linum Tirinum: Used to pick linum tirinum from. Three linum tirinum can be collected from each Linum Tirinum plant. Used for creating armour within The Gauntlet.
  • Phren Roots: Used to chop phren bark from. Three phren barks can be collected from each Phren Roots plant. Used for creating armour within The Gauntlet.
  • Grym Root: Used to pick a grym leaf from. One grym leaf can be collected from each Grym Root plant. Used for creating Egniol potions within The Gauntlet.
  • Fishing Spot: Used to fish raw paddlefish from. Four raw paddlefish can be collected from each Fishing Spot. Used for food within The Gauntlet, healing 20 hitpoints when cooked.

Collecting resources from the aforementioned nodes will also randomly reward the player with crystal shards.

Monsters[edit | edit source]

There are nine types of monsters that can be found within the resource rooms, that can be categorized into three categories:

  • Weak monsters: Crystalline Spiders (level 22), Crystalline Rats (level 24) and Crystalline Bats (level 33).
  • Strong monsters: Crystalline Unicorns (level 48), Crystalline Scorpions (level 64) and Crystalline Wolves (level 74).
  • Demi-bosses: Crystalline Bears (level 172), Crystalline Dragons (level 172) and Crystalline Dark Beasts (level 172).

The above monsters may be killed for the following items:

  • Crystal shards: Used for processing items at the Singing Bowl.
  • Weapon frame: Used for creating the lowest tier bow, halberd or staff at the Singing Bowl.
  • Raw paddlefish: Used for food within The Gauntlet, healing 20 Hitpoints when cooked.
  • Grym leaf: Used for creating Egniol potions within The Gauntlet.
  • Teleport crystal: Used for teleporting to the starting room.
  • Crystal spike: Used to create the highest tier halberd. Guaranteed drop from the Crystalline Bear.
  • Crystal orb: Used to create the highest tier staff. Guaranteed drop from the Crystalline Dragon.
  • Crystalline bowstring: Used to create the highest tier bow. Guaranteed drop from the Crystalline Dark Beast.

Armour and weaponry[edit | edit source]

After exploring the resource rooms and collecting resources for a bit, return to the Singing Bowl to create armour and weapons. Since the Crystalline Hunllef uses protection prayers, two different types of weapons are required for the final boss. To mitigate the damage from the Crystalline Hunllef, it is advised to also create some armour pieces.

Weapons[edit | edit source]

There are three types of weapons: bows (Ranged), halberds (Melee) and staves (Magic). These weapons are available in three tiers: basic, attuned and perfected. Higher tiers are created by upgrading from their previous tiers.

The creation of each of the three weapon types requires the same resources:

  • Basic (tier 1): A weapon frame and 20 crystal shards.
  • Attuned (tier 2): Basic weapon and 60 crystal shards.
  • Perfected (tier 3): Attuned weapon and a crystal spike (for the halberd), crystal orb (for the staff) or crystalline bowstring (for the bow).

Weapons from higher tiers give player higher accuracy and/or damage. See the table below for an overview of each weapon's accuracy:

ItemAttack BonusesDefence BonusesOther
Crystal sceptre810160000000200%000.0
Crystal halberd (basic)686840000000420%011.8
Crystal halberd (attuned)114114120000000880%021.8
Crystal halberd (perfected)1661662800000001380%031.8
Crystal bow (basic)0000720000000%4211.8
Crystal bow (attuned)00001180000000%8811.8
Crystal bow (perfected)00001720000000%13831.8
Crystal staff (basic)0008400000000%011.4
Crystal staff (attuned)00012800000000%021.4
Crystal staff (perfected)00018400000000%031.4

See the table below for an overview of the capabilities of each weapon's maximum hits:

Halberd max hits[A 1] No prayer Ultimate Strength Piety
Crystal halberd (basic) 18 21 22
Crystal halberd (attuned) 26 29 31
Crystal halberd (perfected) 35 39 42
Bow max hits[A 2] No prayer Eagle Eye Rigour
Crystal bow (basic) 18 20 21
Crystal bow (attuned) 25 29 31
Crystal bow (perfected) 34 38 41
Staff max hits No prayer Mystic Might Augury
Crystal staff (basic) 23 23 23
Crystal staff (attuned) 31 31 31
Crystal staff (perfected) 39 39 39
  1. ↑ Based on level 99 Strength and the aggressive attack style.
  2. ↑ Based on level 99 Ranged.

Armour[edit | edit source]

There are three types of armour pieces: helmets, bodies and legs. These armour pieces are available in three tiers: basic, attuned and perfected. Higher tiers are created by upgrading from their previous tiers.

The creation of each armour piece requires the same resources:

  • Basic (tier 1): 40 crystal shards, 1 crystal ore, 1 linum tirinum and 1 phren bark.
  • Attuned helm & legs (tier 2): Basic armour piece, 60 crystal shards, 1 crystal ore, 1 linum tirinum and 1 phren bark.
  • Attuned body (tier 2): Basic armour piece, 60 crystal shards, 2 crystal ores, 2 linum tirinums and 2 phren barks.
  • Perfected (tier 3): Attuned armour piece, 80 crystal shards, 2 crystal ores, 2 linum tirinums and 2 phren barks.

The following table provides an overview of the required resources per armour tier:

Tier 1 Tier 2 Tier 3
Body Legs Helm Total Body Legs Helm Total Total (1+2) Body Legs Helm Total Total (All)
Ore 1 1 1 3 2 1 1 4 7 2 2 2 6 13
Linum 1 1 1 3 2 1 1 4 7 2 2 2 6 13
Bark 1 1 1 3 2 1 1 4 7 2 2 2 6 13
Shards 40 40 40 120 60 60 60 180 300 80 80 80 240 540

Armour pieces from higher tiers give player higher defence bonuses and mitigate more damage of the Crystalline Hunllef's attacks. It appears that the damage reduction is roughly 13.33% per level. See the table below for an overview of each armour piece's bonuses:

ItemAttack BonusesDefence BonusesOther
Crystal helm (basic)22122282828282800%012.7
Crystal helm (attuned)66266484848484800%022.7
Crystal helm (perfected)101031010686868686800%032.7
Crystal body (basic)88388868686868600%0310.0
Crystal body (attuned)12124121210210210210210200%0410.0
Crystal body (perfected)15165161612412412412412400%0510.0
Crystal legs (basic)66266525252525200%029.1
Crystal legs (attuned)101031010747474747400%039.1
Crystal legs (perfected)141441414929292929200%049.1

Wearing pieces of the crystal armour will further reduce damage taken from the Crystalline Hunllef's attacks. The table below describes its max hit while wearing different combinations of armour.

Armour combination Crystalline Hunllef's max hit [A 1] Damage from tornadoes
N/A No armour 12 10-20
Full T1 armour 10 10-16
Full T2 armour 8 7-13
Full T3 armour 6 5-10
  1. ↑ While using the correct protection prayer against its ranged and magic attacks.

Boss room[edit | edit source]

After the 10 minute timer runs out, or when the player feels confident enough to face The Gauntlet's boss, the player may pass the barrier to enter the boss room. This room contains the level 674 Crystalline Hunllef. The Crystalline Hunllef must be defeated to complete The Gauntlet's challenge successfully.

The boss room always lies directly adjacent to the starting room.

If you die as the boss dies, kill count credit will not be awarded.

Corrupted Gauntlet[edit | edit source]

A player in the Corrupted Gauntlet.

After completing the Gauntlet once, players may try the Corrupted Gauntlet, which has increased difficulty compared to the regular Gauntlet.

Differences include:

  • All monsters are Corrupted instead of Crystalline, with increased stats.
  • All items are Corrupted instead of Crystal, with the same stats.
  • The player only has 7.5 minutes to prepare.

Boss Room[edit | edit source]

  • The boss room instead contains the Corrupted Hunllef, which has 1000 health and increased stats. The table below describes its max hit while wearing different combinations of armour.
    • Note that all three pieces of armour must be upgraded to a certain tier in order to successfully reduce the Hunllef's max hit. A tier 1 body with tier 2 helm and legs will still result in the Hunllef having a max hit of 13.
Armour combination Corrupted Hunllef's max hit [A 1] Damage from tornadoes
N/A No armour 16 15-30
Full T1 armour 13 14-25
Full T2 armour 10 10-20
Full T3 armour 8 8-15
  1. ↑ While using the correct protection prayer against its ranged and magic attacks.

Rewards[edit | edit source]

Completing the Corrupted Gauntlet rewards three rolls on an upgraded loot table. The player will also receive a Gauntlet cape upon completion.

Loot table[edit | edit source]

Main article: Reward Chest (The Gauntlet)
Gauntlet completed
The jingle that plays upon completing the Gauntlet.

Upon completing The Gauntlet's challenge, players will receive two rolls on the regular loot table, several crystal shards and a roll for the unique rewards. For more information on the loot table, visit the Reward Chest's page.

Upon completion of the Corrupted challenge, players will receive three rolls on an upgraded loot table, several crystal shards and a roll for the unique rewards with a higher chance of success.

Upon failing the challenge, players might still get rewarded with some lower value loot.

Unique Rewards (Normal Mode)[edit | edit source]

Crystal armour seed11/120[1]6,436,755300,000

Combat Achievements[edit | edit source]

The following Combat Achievement tasks involve the Gauntlet.

Normal Gauntlet[edit | edit source]

Name Description Difficulty Category
Gauntlet Veteran Complete the Gauntlet 5 times. Elite Kill count
3, 2, 1 - Range Kill the Crystalline Hunllef without taking damage off prayer. Elite Perfection
Egniol Diet Kill the Crystalline Hunllef without making an egniol potion within the Gauntlet. Elite Restriction
Crystalline Warrior Kill the Crystalline Hunllef with a full set of perfected armour equipped. Elite Restriction
Wolf Puncher Kill the Crystalline Hunllef without making more than one attuned weapon. Elite Restriction
Gauntlet Master Complete the Gauntlet 20 times. Master Kill count
Perfect Crystalline Hunllef Kill the Crystalline Hunllef without taking damage from: Tornadoes, Damaging Floor or Stomp Attacks. Also, do not take damage off prayer and do not attack the Crystalline Hunleff with the wrong weapon. Master Perfection
Defence Doesn't Matter Kill the Crystalline Hunllef without making any armour within the Gauntlet. Master Restriction
Gauntlet Speed-Chaser Complete the Gauntlet in less than 5 minutes. Master Speed
Gauntlet Speed-Runner Complete the Gauntlet in less than 4 minutes. Grandmaster Speed

Corrupted Gauntlet[edit | edit source]

Name Description Difficulty Category
Corrupted Gauntlet Veteran Complete the Corrupted Gauntlet 5 times. Elite Kill count
3, 2, 1 - Mage Kill the Corrupted Hunllef without taking damage off prayer. Elite Perfection
Corrupted Gauntlet Master Complete the Corrupted Gauntlet 10 times. Master Kill count
Perfect Corrupted Hunllef Kill the Corrupted Hunllef without taking damage from: Tornadoes, Damaging Floor or Stomp Attacks. Also, do not take damage off prayer and do not attack the Corrupted Hunleff with the wrong weapon. Master Perfection
Defence Doesn't Matter II Kill the Corrupted Hunllef without making any armour within the Corrupted Gauntlet. Master Restriction
Corrupted Warrior Kill the Corrupted Hunllef with a full set of perfected corrupted armour equipped. Master Restriction
Corrupted Gauntlet Speed-Chaser Complete a Corrupted Gauntlet in less than 7 minutes and 30 seconds. Master Speed
Corrupted Gauntlet Grandmaster Complete the Corrupted Gauntlet 50 times. Grandmaster Kill count
Egniol Diet II Kill the Corrupted Hunllef without making an egniol potion within the Corrupted Gauntlet. Grandmaster Restriction
Wolf Puncher II Kill the Corrupted Hunllef without making more than one attuned weapon. Grandmaster Restriction
Corrupted Gauntlet Speed-Runner Complete a Corrupted Gauntlet in less than 6 minutes and 30 seconds. Grandmaster Speed

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
2 March 2022
(update)

Entering and leaving The Gauntlet with an amulet of avarice equipped will no longer clear the player's skull.

9 December 2021
(update)

The minimum HiScores 'killcount' required for The Corrupted Gauntlet has been lowered from 10 to 5.

21 July 2021
(update | poll)
  • Players can now make escape crystals to teleport out of the Gauntlet instantly to avoid loss of hardcore ironman status.
  • Players can now make crystal paddlefish, which heals 16 Hitpoints and act as cooked karambwan in that they can be eaten without delay.
30 June 2021
(update)

The enhanced crystal weapon seed has replaced the inactive Blade of Saeldor in the reward chest drop table, and the blade, as well as the Bow of Faerdhinen, can be created from the enhanced weapon seed.

2 July 2020
(update | poll)
  • Messages that appear when receiving crystals in The Gauntlet are now filterable; this does affect the untradeable drop notification for crystal shards from monster drops.
  • The max hits of all variants of the crystal and corrupted staves have been increased by 5.
  • Filling vials and cooking paddlefish now occur in one tick (0.6 seconds).
  • The inner square of rooms are now less randomised, and will always contain the same basic resources required to move on to the rest of The Gauntlet. This does not apply to the Corrupted Gauntlet.
  • Players who have toggled the ability to automatically smash vials can now do so as soon as they've drunk the last dose of an egniol potion.
  • Demi-bosses will now spawn in 6 of the 12 specific rooms of the Gauntlet's outer areas. The rooms in the outer area which they can spawn are the rooms non-adjacent to the corner rooms.
  • The number of total resources required to create tier 2 and 3 armour have been reduced; the number of crystal shards required remain the same.
  • The Crystalline and Corrupted Hunllef now play an animation right before changing attack styles to notify players to quickly change their protection prayers.
2 April 2020
(update)

The Corrupted Gauntlet no longer gives extra Gauntlet capes to players who have one stored in a cape rack.

19 September 2019
(update)

The Game Filter now filters the message displayed in the chatbox when players sing items at the Gauntlet's singing bowl.

8 August 2019
(update)
  • When creating items within the Gauntlet, the interface will remain open provided you have the ingredients to create other items.
  • Killing a duplicate tier 3 creature within the Gauntlet will now have a guaranteed chance to drop a different powerful weapon component, provided you don't already have one. This was previously a 50% chance.
  • The scoreboard in the Gauntlet lobby has been extended to display your deaths and the global deaths for each version of the Gauntlet.
1 August 2019
(update)
  • The Crystalline and Corrupted Hunllef has been altered slightly: Ranged will always be the first attack style, damage has been increased when praying incorrectly (or not at all), and damage has been reduced when praying correctly.
  • Players can no longer remove old school bonds from their bond pouch while in the Gauntlet.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • The minigame shares many similarities with the Daemonheim dungeon used to train the Dungeoneering skill from RuneScape.

References[edit | edit source]

  1. ↑ 1.0 1.1 1.2 1.3 1.4 1.5 1.6 1.7 Jagex. Mod Lenny's Twitter account. 25 October 2019. (Archived from the original on 27 October 2019.)

rawContent:
{{HasStrategy}}
{{HasMMG|Completing The Gauntlet|Completing The Corrupted Gauntlet}}
{{Dangerous|noitems=yes}}
{{Infobox Activity
|name = The Gauntlet
|image = [[File:The Gauntlet.png|300px]]
|release = [[25 July]] [[2019]]
|update = Song of the Elves
|type = Minigame
|members = Yes
|location = [[Prifddinas]]
|players = 1
|skills = Combat, skilling
|currency = No
|tutorial = No
|music = [[The Gauntlet (music track)|The Gauntlet]]
|map = {{Map|x=3228|y=6116|r=4|mapID=29|mtype=square}}
}}
{{otheruses|The Gauntlet|the gloves|gauntlets}}
'''The Gauntlet''' is a solo [[minigame]] in [[Prifddinas]] in which the player is given a limited amount of time to explore a randomly generated dungeon layout, gather various resources and supplies by skilling and defeating crystalline monsters, all in preparation to defeat the [[Crystalline Hunllef]], which is based upon a deadly wolf-like predator from the elven homeworld of Tarddiad. The Gauntlet was created as a training ground by the [[Amlodd Clan]] to ensure their warriors were capable of defending Prifddinas during the [[God Wars]].

The Gauntlet can be found by entering the [[Gauntlet Portal]], found in the north-western part of Prifddinas.

Players '''cannot''' bring any items into The Gauntlet; when entering the minigame, all items currently on the player will be automatically stored for its duration. It is a dangerous minigame, so [[hardcore ironmen]] will lose their hardcore status, and ultimate ironmen will lose items in [[instanced banks]] should they die in The Gauntlet.

The area contains resource nodes, [[grym leaf|herbs]] and [[raw paddlefish|fish]] obtainable through [[Mining]], [[Woodcutting]], [[Fishing]] and other gathering methods, in order to make weapons, armour, potions and food. These various resources do not require a specific skill level to gather. The dungeon will also contain various crystalline monsters, such as [[Crystalline Bat|bats]], [[Crystalline Unicorn|unicorns]] and [[Crystalline Dark Beast|dark beasts]], which can be killed for further supplies. Higher level monsters will offer better drops at the cost of taking more time to defeat.

Completion of The Gauntlet will reward players with various loot, including [[crystal armour seed]]s for [[crystal armour]], as well as [[Enhanced crystal weapon seed]]s for the [[Blade of Saeldor]] or the [[Bow of faerdhinen|Bow of Faerdhinen]] and the [[crystal shard]]s required to charge the items. Failing to finish, either by death or leaving early, will give a small token reward based upon how well the player performed, but won't grant any chance of unique items.

==Basic overview==
The player will spawn in the starting room of a 7x7 grid of rooms adjacent to the centre room that contains The Gauntlet's boss: the [[Crystalline Hunllef]]. The player has 10 minutes to prepare to fight this boss, which is indicated by a timer. If the timer runs out, the player will automatically get teleported into the boss room. The player can also choose to manually enter the boss room before the counter ends.

During this 10 minute preparation time, the player may use the resources of The Gauntlet's environment to create a set up to challenge the Crystalline Hunllef. This set up may consist of three tiers of halberds, staves, bows, helmets, body armours and leg armours, as well as food and a potion that restores [[run energy]] and [[prayer points]].

===Starting items===
{{Inventory|align=right
|Crystal axe (The Gauntlet) |Crystal pickaxe (The Gauntlet) |Crystal harpoon (The Gauntlet) |Pestle and mortar (The Gauntlet)
|Teleport crystal (The Gauntlet)\1 | | | 
| | | | 
| | | | 
| | | | 
| | | | 
| | | | 
}}
The player starts with a few items in their inventory and they will be wielding a [[crystal sceptre]]. These items will be needed for exploring the rooms and collecting resources.

{| class="wikitable align-center-1" |
|-
! colspan=2 |Item
!Effect
|-
|{{plinkt|Crystal sceptre}}
|This item is required to light nodes (i.e. to visit new rooms). It can also be used as a weak melee weapon. 
|-
|{{plinkt|Crystal axe (The Gauntlet)|txt=Crystal axe}}
|Used to chop {{plink|Phren bark}}
|-
|{{plinkt|Crystal pickaxe (The Gauntlet)|txt=Crystal pickaxe}}
|Used to mine {{plink|Crystal ore}}
|-
|{{plinkt|Crystal harpoon (The Gauntlet)|txt=Crystal harpoon}}
|Used to fish {{plink|Raw paddlefish}}
|-
|{{plinkt|Pestle and mortar (The Gauntlet)|txt=Pestle and mortar}}
|Used to grind {{plink|Crystal shards}}<sup>x10</sup> into {{plink|Crystal dust}}<sup>x10</sup> and to grind each [[Crystal spike]]''',''' [[Crystal orb]]''',''' [[Crystalline bowstring]] into {{plink|Crystal shards}}<sup>x80</sup>
|-
|{{plinkt|Teleport crystal (The Gauntlet)|txt=Teleport crystal}}
|Single-use item for teleporting the player back to the starting room.
|}
{{Clear}}

===Starting room===
[[File:The Gauntlet Starting Room.png|200px|right|thumb|Features of the starting room]]
The player will start adjacent to the central room. This room contains a few features that are used for processing the collected resources.
*'''[[Crystal Singing Recipes]]''': A bookstand players can click to get an overview of all recipes for armour and weaponry found within The Gauntlet.
*'''[[Egniol Potions]]''': A bookstand players can click to read a text describing the use and recipe of [[egniol potion]]s.
*'''[[Range (The Gauntlet)|Range]]''': Used to cook {{plink|Raw paddlefish}} into {{plink|Paddlefish}}.
*'''[[Singing Bowl]]''': Used to craft vials, teleport crystals, armour and weapons.
*'''[[Teleport Platform (The Gauntlet)|Teleport Platform]]''': Used to abandon the current challenge.
*'''[[Tool Storage]]''': Used to re-obtain [[crystal sceptre]], [[Crystal axe (The Gauntlet)|crystal axe]], [[Crystal pickaxe (The Gauntlet)|crystal pickaxe]], [[Crystal harpoon (The Gauntlet)|crystal harpoon]] and [[Pestle and mortar (The Gauntlet)|pestle and mortar]]
*'''[[Water Pump (The Gauntlet)|Water Pump]]''': Used to turn {{plink|Vial (The Gauntlet)|txt=vials}} into {{plink|Water-filled vial|txt=water-filled vials}}, which are needed to make {{plink|Egniol potion (3)|txt=Egniol potions}}.
{{Clear}}

===Resource rooms===
Each room in The Gauntlet, except for the starting room and the boss room, contains resource nodes and/or monsters. These resource nodes and monsters are farmed to collect resources that can be processed at the [[Singing Bowl]] in the starting room.

====Resource nodes====
[[File:Phren Roots.png|right|100px]]
There are five types of resource nodes. Each resource room will contain zero to five resource nodes. A resource room may contain a combination of different resource nodes.
*'''[[Crystal Deposit]]''': Used to mine [[crystal ore]] from. Three crystal ores can be collected from each Crystal Deposit. Used for creating armour within The Gauntlet.
*'''[[Linum Tirinum (plant)|Linum Tirinum]]''': Used to pick [[linum tirinum]] from. Three linum tirinum can be collected from each Linum Tirinum plant. Used for creating armour within The Gauntlet.
*'''[[Phren Roots]]''': Used to chop [[phren bark]] from. Three phren barks can be collected from each Phren Roots plant. Used for creating armour within The Gauntlet.
*'''[[Grym Root]]''': Used to pick a [[grym leaf]] from. One grym leaf can be collected from each Grym Root plant. Used for creating Egniol potions within The Gauntlet.
*'''[[Fishing Spot]]''': Used to fish [[raw paddlefish]] from. Four raw paddlefish can be collected from each Fishing Spot. Used for food within The Gauntlet, healing 20 hitpoints when cooked.

Collecting resources from the aforementioned nodes will also randomly reward the player with [[crystal shards]].

====Monsters====
There are nine types of monsters that can be found within the resource rooms, that can be categorized into three categories:
*'''Weak monsters''': [[Crystalline Spider]]s (level 22), [[Crystalline Rat]]s (level 24) and [[Crystalline Bat]]s (level 33).
*'''Strong monsters''': [[Crystalline Unicorn]]s (level 48), [[Crystalline Scorpion]]s (level 64) and [[Crystalline Wolf|Crystalline Wolves]] (level 74).
*'''Demi-bosses''': [[Crystalline Bear]]s (level 172), [[Crystalline Dragon]]s (level 172) and [[Crystalline Dark Beast]]s (level 172).

[[File:Weapon frame detail.png|right|100px]]
[[File:Crystal spike detail.png|right|100px]]
The above monsters may be killed for the following items:
*'''[[Crystal shards]]''': Used for processing items at the [[Singing Bowl]].
*'''[[Weapon frame]]''': Used for creating the lowest tier bow, halberd or staff at the Singing Bowl.
*'''[[Raw paddlefish]]''': Used for food within The Gauntlet, healing 20 [[Hitpoints]] when cooked. 
*'''[[Grym leaf]]''': Used for creating [[Egniol potion]]s within The Gauntlet.
*'''[[Teleport crystal (The Gauntlet)|Teleport crystal]]''': Used for teleporting to the starting room.
*'''[[Crystal spike]]''': Used to create the highest tier halberd. Guaranteed drop from the [[Crystalline Bear]].
*'''[[Crystal orb]]''': Used to create the highest tier staff. Guaranteed drop from the [[Crystalline Dragon]].
*'''[[Crystalline bowstring]]''': Used to create the highest tier bow. Guaranteed drop from the [[Crystalline Dark Beast]].

===Armour and weaponry===
After exploring the resource rooms and collecting resources for a bit, return to the [[Singing Bowl]] to create armour and weapons. Since the [[Crystalline Hunllef]] uses [[protection prayers]], two different types of weapons are required for the final boss. To mitigate the damage from the Crystalline Hunllef, it is advised to also create some armour pieces.

====Weapons====
[[File:Crystal halberd (perfected) equipped.png|right|150px]]
There are three types of weapons: bows ([[Ranged]]), halberds ([[Melee]]) and staves ([[Magic]]). These weapons are available in three tiers: basic, attuned and perfected. Higher tiers are created by upgrading from their previous tiers.

The creation of each of the three weapon types requires the same resources:
*'''Basic''' (tier 1): A [[weapon frame]] and 20 [[crystal shards]].
*'''Attuned''' (tier 2): Basic weapon and 60 crystal shards.
*'''Perfected''' (tier 3): Attuned weapon and a [[crystal spike]] (for the halberd), [[crystal orb]] (for the staff) or [[crystalline bowstring]] (for the bow).

Weapons from higher tiers give player higher accuracy and/or damage. See the table below for an overview of each weapon's accuracy:

{{Infotable Bonuses|Crystal sceptre|Crystal halberd (basic)|Crystal halberd (attuned)|Crystal halberd (perfected)|Crystal bow (basic)|Crystal bow (attuned)|Crystal bow (perfected)|Crystal staff (basic)|Crystal staff (attuned)|Crystal staff (perfected)|nototals=yes|sort=amagic,arange,aslash}}

See the table below for an overview of the capabilities of each weapon's maximum hits:

!No prayer

{{Reflist|group="A"}}

====Armour====
[[File:Perfected crystal armour (male) equipped.png|right|150px]]
There are three types of armour pieces: helmets, bodies and legs. These armour pieces are available in three tiers: basic, attuned and perfected. Higher tiers are created by upgrading from their previous tiers.

The creation of each armour piece requires the same resources:
*'''Basic''' (tier 1): 40 [[crystal shards]], 1 [[crystal ore]], 1 [[linum tirinum]] and 1 [[phren bark]].
*'''Attuned helm & legs''' (tier 2): Basic armour piece, 60 crystal shards, 1 crystal ore, 1 linum tirinum and 1 phren bark.
*'''Attuned''' '''body''' (tier 2): Basic armour piece, 60 crystal shards, 2 crystal ores, 2 linum tirinums and 2 phren barks.
*'''Perfected''' (tier 3): Attuned armour piece, 80 crystal shards, 2 crystal ores, 2 linum tirinums and 2 phren barks.

The following table provides an overview of the required resources per armour tier:

Armour pieces from higher tiers give player higher defence bonuses and mitigate more damage of the Crystalline Hunllef's attacks. It appears that the damage reduction is roughly 13.33% per level. See the table below for an overview of each armour piece's bonuses:
{{Infotable Bonuses|Crystal helm (basic)|Crystal helm (attuned)|Crystal helm (perfected)|nototals=yes|sort=dmagic|cwidth=42px|iwidth=190px}}

{{Infotable Bonuses|Crystal body (basic)|Crystal body (attuned)|Crystal body (perfected)|nototals=yes|sort=dmagic|noheader=yes|cwidth=42px|iwidth=190px}}

{{Infotable Bonuses|Crystal legs (basic)|Crystal legs (attuned)|Crystal legs (perfected)|nototals=yes|sort=dmagic|noheader=yes|cwidth=42px|iwidth=190px}}

Wearing pieces of the crystal armour will further reduce damage taken from the Crystalline Hunllef's attacks. The table below describes its max hit while wearing different combinations of armour.

{| class="wikitable"

!Damage from tornadoes

|{{NA}}||No armour||12||10-20

|}

{{Reflist|group=A}}

===Boss room===
[[File:Crystalline Hunllef.png|right|150px]]
After the 10 minute timer runs out, or when the player feels confident enough to face The Gauntlet's boss, the player may pass the barrier to enter the boss room. This room contains the level 674 [[Crystalline Hunllef]]. The Crystalline Hunllef must be defeated to complete The Gauntlet's challenge successfully.

The boss room always lies directly adjacent to the starting room.

If you die as the boss dies, kill count credit will not be awarded.

==Corrupted Gauntlet==
[[File:The Corrupted Gauntlet.png|thumb|300px|A player in the Corrupted Gauntlet.]]
After completing the Gauntlet once, players may try the Corrupted Gauntlet, which has increased difficulty compared to the regular Gauntlet.

Differences include:
*All monsters are Corrupted instead of Crystalline, with increased stats.
*All items are Corrupted instead of Crystal, with the same stats.
*The player only has 7.5 minutes to prepare.

===Boss Room===
*The boss room instead contains the [[Corrupted Hunllef]], which has 1000 health and increased stats. The table below describes its max hit while wearing different combinations of armour.
**Note that all three pieces of armour must be upgraded to a certain tier in order to successfully reduce the Hunllef's max hit. A tier 1 body with tier 2 helm and legs will still result in the Hunllef having a max hit of 13.

{|class="wikitable"
! colspan=2 | Armour combination
!Corrupted Hunllef's max hit <ref group="A">While using the correct [[protection prayer]] against its ranged and magic attacks.</ref>
!Damage from tornadoes
|-
|{{NA}}||No armour||16||15-30
|-
|{{plinkp|Corrupted helm (basic)}}{{plinkp|Corrupted body (basic)}}{{plinkp|Corrupted legs (basic)}}||Full T1 armour||13||''14-25''
|-
|{{plinkp|Corrupted helm (attuned)}}{{plinkp|Corrupted body (attuned)}}{{plinkp|Corrupted legs (attuned)}}||Full T2 armour||10||''10-20''
|-
|{{plinkp|Corrupted helm (perfected)}}{{plinkp|Corrupted body (perfected)}}{{plinkp|Corrupted legs (perfected)}}||Full T3 armour||''8''||''8-15''
|}

{{Reflist|group=A}}

===Rewards===
Completing the Corrupted Gauntlet rewards three rolls on an upgraded loot table. The player will also receive a {{plink|Gauntlet cape}} upon completion.

==Loot table==
{{Main|Reward Chest (The Gauntlet)}}
{{Listen
|title = Gauntlet completed
|align = right
|filename = Gauntlet completion.ogg
|desc = The jingle that plays upon completing the Gauntlet.}}

Upon completing The Gauntlet's challenge, players will receive two rolls on the regular loot table, several [[crystal shard]]s and a roll for the unique rewards. For more information on the loot table, visit the [[Reward Chest (The Gauntlet)|Reward Chest]]'s page.

Upon completion of the Corrupted challenge, players will receive three rolls on an upgraded loot table, several crystal shards and a roll for the unique rewards with a higher chance of success.

Upon failing the challenge, players might still get rewarded with some lower value loot.

===Unique Rewards (Normal Mode)===
{{DropsTableHead|smw=No}}

{{DropsLineReward|name=Crystal weapon seed|quantity=1|rarity=1/120|raritynotes={{CiteTwitter|author=Mod Lenny|url=https://twitter.com/JagexLenny/status/1187713588653412355|date=25 October 2019|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20191027075038/https:/twitter.com/JagexLenny/status/1187713588653412355|archivedate=27 October 2019|name=Drop Tables}}}}

{{DropsLineReward|name=Youngllef|quantity=1|rarity=1/2000|raritynotes={{NamedRef|Drop Tables}}}}
{{DropsTableBottom}}

{{DropsLineReward|name=Youngllef|quantity=1|rarity=1/800|raritynotes={{NamedRef|Drop Tables}}}}
{{DropsTableBottom}}

==Changes==
{{Subject changes header}}
{{Subject changes
|date = 2 March 2022
|update = Group Ironman Improvements
|poll =
|change = Entering and leaving The Gauntlet with an [[amulet of avarice]] equipped will no longer clear the player's [[Skull (status)|skull]].
}}
{{Subject changes
|date = 9 December 2021
|update = Grand Exchange Tax & Item Sink
|change = The minimum [[HiScores]] 'killcount' required for The Corrupted Gauntlet has been lowered from 10 to 5.
}}
{{Subject changes
|date = 21 July 2021
|update = Combat Achievements
|poll = A Night At The Theatre and Old School Content Poll 75: PvM
|change =
* Players can now make [[escape crystal]]s to teleport out of the Gauntlet instantly to avoid loss of [[hardcore ironman]] status.
* Players can now make [[crystal paddlefish]], which heals 16 Hitpoints and act as [[cooked karambwan]] in that they can be eaten without delay.
}}
{{Subject changes
|date = 30 June 2021
|update = Phosani's Nightmare
|change = The [[enhanced crystal weapon seed]] has replaced the inactive Blade of Saeldor in the reward chest drop table, and the blade, as well as the [[Bow of Faerdhinen]], can be created from the enhanced weapon seed.
}}
{{Subject changes
|date = 2 July 2020
|update = Poll 71 and Death Feedback Changes
|poll = Old School Content Poll 71: Gauntlet, Grotesques, CoX and more
|change = 
*Messages that appear when receiving crystals in The Gauntlet are now filterable; this does affect the untradeable drop notification for crystal shards from monster drops.
*The max hits of all variants of the crystal and corrupted staves have been increased by 5.
*Filling vials and cooking paddlefish now occur in one tick (0.6 seconds).
*The inner square of rooms are now less randomised, and will always contain the same basic resources required to move on to the rest of The Gauntlet. This '''does not''' apply to the Corrupted Gauntlet.
*Players who have toggled the ability to automatically smash vials can now do so as soon as they've drunk the last dose of an egniol potion.
*Demi-bosses will now spawn in 6 of the 12 specific rooms of the Gauntlet's outer areas. The rooms in the outer area which they can spawn are the rooms non-adjacent to the corner rooms.
*The number of total resources required to create tier 2 and 3 armour have been reduced; the number of crystal shards required remain the same.
*The Crystalline and Corrupted Hunllef now play an animation right before changing attack styles to notify players to quickly change their protection prayers.
}}
{{Subject changes
|date = 2 April 2020
|update = Easter Event
|change = The Corrupted Gauntlet no longer gives extra [[Gauntlet cape]]s to players who have one stored in a [[cape rack]].
}}
{{Subject changes
|date = 19 September 2019
|update = Small Changes and Bugfixes
|change = The Game Filter now filters the message displayed in the chatbox when players sing items at the Gauntlet's singing bowl.
}}
{{Subject changes
|date = 8 August 2019
|update = Smithing and Silver Crafting Interfaces
|poll =
|change = 
*When creating items within the Gauntlet, the interface will remain open provided you have the ingredients to create other items.
*Killing a duplicate tier 3 creature within the Gauntlet will now have a guaranteed chance to drop a different powerful weapon component, provided you don't already have one. This was previously a 50% chance.
*The scoreboard in the Gauntlet lobby has been extended to display your deaths and the global deaths for each version of the Gauntlet.
}}
{{Subject changes
|date = 1 August 2019
|update = SOTE Changes and Small Game Updates
|poll =
|change = 
*The Crystalline and Corrupted Hunllef has been altered slightly: Ranged will always be the first attack style, damage has been increased when praying incorrectly (or not at all), and damage has been reduced when praying correctly.
*Players can no longer remove [[old school bond]]s from their bond pouch while in the Gauntlet.
}}
{{Subject changes footer}}

==Trivia==
*The minigame shares many similarities with the {{RSL|Daemonheim}} dungeon used to train the {{RSL|Dungeoneering}} skill from ''RuneScape''.
